Function to create a glyph dataset and plot with maps

glyph.Rd

Function to create a glyph dataset and plot with maps

glyph_pixel(data, x_major, y_major, var, gvar, width = ggplot2::rel(0.7))

quality_map(data, type = c("ggplot", "interactive"))

Arguments

data

for glyph_pixel, a data object; for glyph_map, a data of class "glyphplot", created by glyph_pixel() or GGally::glyph()
x_major

the main x axis
y_major

the main y axis
var

the variable that contains all the variable names, in the long form
gvar

the grouping variable
width

the width adjustment
type

either a static or interactive plot

References

glyph_pixel is inspired by the glyph function in the package GGally: https://github.com/ggobi/ggally/blob/master/R/gglyph.R

Examples

# add missing summaries
out <- climate_small %>%
         add_missing_prct(prcp:tmin) %>%
         add_missing_dscrb() %>%
         tidyr::pivot_longer(cols = c(ends_with("missing"), ends_with("dscrb")),
                             names_to = c("var", ".value"), names_pattern ="(.*)_(.*)")

#> Using `date` as index variable.
#> Using `date` as index variable.

# create a glyphplot dataset with `glyph_pixel`
glyph_df <- glyph_pixel(out,
                        x_major = long,
                        y_major = lat,
                        var = "var",
                        gvar = "station")

# create the glyph plot
quality_map(glyph_df, type = "ggplot")
